about_the_game:
When sweat saves blood, and blood saves life, what will save "tears"?

A.C. 1935, war breaks out...

In A.C. 1918, the "Witzland Empire" was defeated in the Great War, dismantled, and re-established as a republic.

The republic's military was limited to 100,000 troops by the armistice treaty. Despite post-war chaos and poverty, there was a breath of peace in the air.

In A.C. 1930, a global economic depression struck countries worldwide, intensifying international tensions and internal divisions.

The republic's military applied to the League of Nations Council for permission to increase its forces for maintaining domestic order and guarding the borders.

This request was partially approved, and the republic's military was allowed to increase its personnel by several thousand. Young soldiers began enlisting in the ranks.

Gertrude Rommel was one of them. Having lost her parents in the war, she fled from her stepmother's house and endured rigorous training at the military academy alongside her comrades. She was finally assigned as an officer in the 601st Field Military Police Battalion, the republic's first all-female unit.

However, in A.C. 1935, the era did not grant her the peaceful military life she hoped for.

The "Revolutionary Socialism Council Federation" a major power in the East, began advancing to liberate the western continent by breaking through the borders.

She must reorganize her crumbling unit and face the harsh realities of the battlefield.

Turn-based Tactical Simulation Game

  • Command your troops and conquer the stages.

  • Enhance your units and skills with the experience points you’ve earned.

  • Purchase tactical cards to change the tide of battle.

  • Immerse yourself in a war chronicle filled with colorful characters.

  • Cooperate with subordinates, colleagues, and superiors to survive the battlefield.
